Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The Stamford branch is closing and everybody's just packing up their stuff. Andy Bernard made these tasteful hats.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to office worker] That's the other thing you got to watch out... [to Jim] Yo! Tuna! I wanna talk to you about this new boss, Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So what's he like? Likes? Dislikes? Favorite sports? Favorite movies? Favorite men's magazines?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? I think you just need to meet him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Playing your cards close to the vest. I get it. Good luck over there, Tuna. Cross me and I will destroy you.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: This is going to be an adventure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. This is going to be very interesting. All right, I'm out of here. See you later?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Right on. [to Andy] Hey is that Josh's computer?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] I could beat that on a skateboard.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, well my feet don't. And I can still crush that time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really, Dwight? How fast are you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's just put it this way. Last weekend I outran a black pepper snake.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am fast. To give you a reference point. I'm somewhere between a snake and a mongoose. And a panther.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Man, what is taking Toby so long?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I'll just time him later.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Am I being mean to Dwight? I don't know. I did just make him run around the building and I have no intention of timing him. This isn't even a stopwatch. It's a digital thermometer. He does make my life harder, sometimes. And on purpose. Like he tried to put meters on the bathroom stalls as a way of bringing in more money for the company. [yells to Dwight] Hey, three more laps to go. Gotta pick it up if you're going to beat Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I should probably get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Karen Filip... [In Italian voice] Ka-ren Fili-pell-li.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My branch is absorbing the Stamford branch. Or, as I like to put it, my family is doubling in size. That's all I'm going to say about it because I have a gigantic performance ahead of me. And I have to get into my head and focus. [exhales]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not firing somebody on the first day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no! Not somebody. Gardner.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Japanese camp guards of World War II always chose one man to kill whenever a batch of new prisoners arrived. I always wondered how they chose the man who was to die. I think I would have been good at choosing the person.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Got the food? Good! Looky-looky-looky. What I want you to do... set it up in the conference room, please. Make it look nice. As if you are trying to impress a much older man who's way out of your league.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes! I'm in a good mood today! I'm excited to meet all the new people and to see my old friend again, definitely. That's always a thing that makes people happy... to have an old friend back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah! Ding-ding-ding-ding-ding. Our first arrival. Welcome to Scranton. This is Hannah Smoterich-Barr.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Welcome to our humble abode. Follow me to your desk. Your ball and chain is right over here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know for a lot of these people this is the only family they have. So... As far as I'm concerned, [holds up WORLD'S BEST BOSS mug] this says 'World's Best Dad'.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah! There he is Tony... what's your last name?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gardner! I knew that. There you go. Gift bag... for you. [laughs] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, I didn't get a gift bag.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, they're just for guests. If there are any left over, you can buy one later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wh..and coupons... to various hot spots around Scranton. [to Tony] All right! Let me show you to your area, sir. Come on, big guy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks. My Mom made it for me.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Really? That's so cool. I've always wanted to learn...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Welcome, welcome, welcome! [in robot voice] Take me to your leader. Oh wait, I am your leader.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Uh wait, are you a robot or a Martian?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm... dah. I am actually your boss, Michael Scott. Welcome. Wow! You are very exotic looking. Was your dad a G.I. or uh?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'll be the Number Two guy here in Scranton in six weeks. How? Name repetition, personality mirroring, and never breaking off a handshake. I'm always thinking one step ahead. Like a carpenter that makes stairs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah! You must be Andy Bernard. Aloha and welcome!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And you must be Michael Scott. Aloha and... hello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A-ha-ha-ho. Very good! Welcome to our little kingdom. Ah, we have a bag of nifty gifties for you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Michael, thank you for welcoming me to your little kingdom, Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They are nifty! They're nifty gifties.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know who I really like? Is this guy Andy Bernard. He has got this very likable way about him.

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: ...which is why they need a passing game.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Jim] No way. Get him out of here. We don't want any of this kind in here. Good to see you, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Martin] How are you? Martin Nash, I presume? This is a little gift bag for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Free of charge. Follow me, I will show you where all the slaves work. [shakes head] Not... so, your desk is...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm Jim. I'm new here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my god! It's really you!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I was just doing a little joke there about how we'd never met...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Awesome! Good to be back. The place looks really good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's really good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where do I stand with Pam? Um... no idea. I mean, we're friends. Always have been friends. Um... .that is where we stand.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, well, well. Look what the cat dragged in from Stamford.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fact - I am older. I am wiser. Do not mess with me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know what you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have a smudge on my forehead?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why are you looking at my forehead?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! How are you man? Good to see... you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm good! How are you? So...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. Are you sitting here now?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um... unless you really, really want it back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, man, it's really you're call.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whispers] Let me get that for you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah. Jim is a nice guy. That's why I got the desk.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, this came with the Stamford book. [Sets down box that says: Personnel Files Stamford CT Office Confidential] Can you take care of it?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: In general, they do not give me much responsibility. But they do let me shred the company documents. And that is really all I need.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Michael Scott. Thank you. I appreciate it, Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello. I don't believe we've been introduced. Dwight Schrute. Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Andy Bernard. Regional Director in Charge of Sales.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So you'll be reporting to me, then.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Which on a film set is the highest title there is. Do you know anything about film?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know everything about film. I've seen over 240 of them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just wanted to say hi.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: How are you? Hey. Welcome back. [puts out fist to bump]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Is that like your new thing?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, it's nothing. We'll just... [shakes hand]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. Good to be back.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: All right... sorry... sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This thing is so awesome. It will shred anything. Ooh! It will shred a CD. It will shred... a credit card. It will shred... oh! [whispers] Shoot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking to himself] I present the orientation video.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which is higher? Assistant Regional Manager or Regional Director in Charge of Sales?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I told you the titles are irrelevant. They just relate to pay scale.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. So who gets paid more? Me or Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is not a matter of more or less. Your pay is just different. Okay? All right! Show time, part one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't care! Dwight! You all report to me! That's all that matters! The rest of it just work out amongst yourselves, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Work it out amongst your selves!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Please! I have a company to run. Well, you let me run the company?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh! Oh my god! I have so much to tell you!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yes! Tom Cruise and Katie Holmes? They had a baby and they named it Suri. And then Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie? They had a baby, too, and they named it Shiloh. And both babies are amazing!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Everybody settled in? Good. Why don't we all proceed in to the conference room? Or, should I say, the banquet hall. For... drum roll, please [makes drum roll noises], the official Merger Day All-Family Welcome Breakfast. Come on in!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope. Um... for the guests it is. For you, consider it cow-meat. Strictly taboo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, then... consider it poisoned beef. No touchy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's not beef... just... sit down, please. [talks to group] Welcome. Help yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Um... You might want these orientation materials.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wrong. Toby, this is an orientation not a borientation.[talks to group] Okay. Do not worry. All of your questions are about to be answered. Cell phones and pagers off, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's face it. Moving to a new job can be very stressful. So I have made an orientation video especially for you newcomers. But it's not like any orientation video that any of you have ever seen. It's funny. It's got a little bit of a zing to it and I hope that it gives you a flavor of what we're all about here at Dunder Mifflin. And what we're all about here in Scranton. So let's just all laugh together and watch "Lazy Scranton".

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sittin' in my office with a plate of grilled bacon, call my man Dwight just to see what was shakin'.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yo Mike, our town is dope and pretty.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So check out how we live

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The Electric City. Call poison control if you're bit by a spider.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But check that it's covered by your health care provider!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It reminds me of the orientation video showed on my first day. 'The Scranton Witch Project'.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in video] I am so scared... when people don't label their personal food.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You like coal mines and you wanna see 'em, Well, check it out, yo, the Anthracite Museum! Plenty of space in the parking lot,

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But the little cars go in the compact spot

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on video in background] Spot. Scranton. What? The Electric City. Scranton.What? The Electric City. Scranton. What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, so far, I think it is killin'. I thought it would either be an 'A' or an 'A+' but I completely forgot that there's an 'A++'.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [recording phone message] This is Karen Filippelli. Please leave a message.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [recording] This is Karen Filippelli. Please leave a message.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not bad, but you are Italian so... try it more Italian.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [recording] [in bad Italian accent] Dis is Kar-en Fill-uh-pel-li. Please leava me da message. A bon danza.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, buddy. Anything new to report?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you mean to me? From you? Cause that's how it works.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Am I trying to get under his skin? Yes. Because the angrier he gets, the more marginalized he becomes. Meanwhile, Andy Bernard is out there layin' on the charm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Angela. Check this out. It's my new screen saver.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you. You have such a pretty smile by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah. I'm trying to move away from that. Getting into more of a bottled water phase.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So when do I get to hear everything? Are you still getting unpacked or... you want to grab a coffee or something after work?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh! Um... tonight, actually? No. I'm uh just still getting settled.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, no! You know. Whenever.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. You're not interrupting anything. Nope. I'm...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. [to Pam] I should probably get back to work. Get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The day's going fine. It's been a little chaotic but it's fine. It's great! A lot of distractions. But, it's good.

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: [using breast pump] Take a picture. It'll last longer.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. It's just, it's a little distracting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is that? A squid's eye or...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Right place at the right time.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Must be an... air freshener plugged in somewhere. It smells like a funeral home.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, I'll help you find it.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I... I... I, uh, think I'm just allergic to your perfume.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: It's just my crazy nose. I'm... uh, used to different smells.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Bob Vance bought this perfume for me in Metropolitan Orlando. It's made from real pine.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You have a lot to learn about this town, sweetie.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't know who these new people think they are. I've sat downwind of Phyllis' stinky perfumes for years. Never said a word.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: People hate people that are different from them. That's natural. But you know what makes people forget their differences? A great show. That is why I created the 'Integration Celebration'. This is the moment when Scranton and Stamford come together as one. United in applause.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know what a lot of you must be thinking. 'Wow! What a day! Feels more like a night at a party than a day at work.' Well, in my opinion, business should feel like a night out. A night... at... the Roxbury. Okay. There's supposed to be music and it's... I got it, I got it! I got it. Dwight! Just.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sings drum beat intro to 'What is Love?']

Quote.Speaker: Andy & Michael
Quote.Text: Don't hurt me! Baby, don't hurt me!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You me? You me? Me you? You! You! You me! Bow Bow Bow!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You me? You me? Me you me! You! You! You me you! You! Oh my nose so itchy, why's my nose so itchy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, probably because of all the nose candy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs hysterically] Okay, I told you these guys had a sense of humor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, all right, I'm on a roll.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why are the new people on the table? To show them that we are not above them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not today. No. Tony! Please join your cohorts on the table if you would.

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: Uh... this is difficult, for me.

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: No. I mean I can't physically. I can't get on the table.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well. Just use the momentum of your lower half to hoist yourself up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I'll help. I will...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't be shy! Dwight! Let's do this!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on. We're doing this thing! Let's get up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bend at the knees. Okay, here we go. Here we go. I'm under this... I'm under this hock here. I don't know what I'm grabbing here.

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: All right. All right. Stop. Put me down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We've almost got it. Push it! Push it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You've got it, you've got it.

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: PUT ME DOWN RIGHT NOW or else!

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: It's just not going to work for me.

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: I was on the fence about this and... it's just not a good fit.

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: I can't work here. I have to quit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can't quit! On the first day. That's [deep voice] heresy, my friend! [regular voice] Okay, let's talk about this. What happened? I mean, what... Was it Toby? Did he say something? Cause he's... what?

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: No. Toby was helpful. He was very kind. It's just your management style.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My management style? So... didn't you think 'Lazy Scranton' was funny?

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: No. Was it supposed to be funny?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, don't bother quitting because you're fired.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are fired! I'm sorry, but we don't have quitters on this team! Just clean out your desk!

Quote.Speaker: Tony
Quote.Text: But there's nothing in my desk except coupons.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't try to apologize to me, man! It's too late. Just get out! Take your bad vibes with you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That was my advice. Remember? I'm the one who suggested that you fire him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Probably the best advice you ever gave me, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And what advice has Andy given to you today that you have acted on? Would 'none' be an accurate estimate? None advice? [whispers] Fire Andy. Fire. Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight may have won the battle. But I will win... the next battle.

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: Tony was right. This environment is dysfunctional.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Maybe that's because some people treat it like their own private Hooters strip club.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa, Angela! Hold on. Hooters is a restaurant. With over 400 locations worldwide.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Back to work. We don't have to get along. We just have to work together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. We do have to get along. Can't we all just get along? Or have we forgotten the words of the Reverend King.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The word merger comes from the word marriage. And that was what today was supposed to be. The loving union between people. Instead, it has become like when my Mom moved in with Jeff. And once again, it becomes my job to fix it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey, everybody! Something happened! Those guys from Vance Refrigeration, they let the air out of our tires.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! They punk'd us! They punk'd us good! Come on. Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Does Bob Vance work for Vance Refrigeration?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Man, they got us so bad. We cannot let them get away with this. We have got to pull together as one and steal their refrigerators.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't... I don't think we can do that.

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Hey! Why doesn't your car have a flat tire?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why? I will tell you why. Because they saved the worst for me. They put a hate note under my windshield wiper. Check this out. It's so hateful. [reads note] "You guys SUCK! You can never pull together as one and revenge us. That is why you SUCK!"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No, no, no. No. You are falling for it. You're playing right into their hands. This is just what they want you to do. Don't, oh...

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: [to Stanley] What's up with this guy?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Got an hour? I'll try to explain.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: THIS IS EGREGIOUS! This is egregious!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Trust me. It only gets worse.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, we find little times during the day.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: How are we going to get home?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Bob Vance has an air pump. He said he'd fill all our tires up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See that? Mission accomplished. Like a bunch of fourth graders. Sometimes, what brings the kids together is hating the lunch lady. Although that'll change. Because, by the end of the fourth grade, the lunch lady was actually the person I hung out with the most. [answers phone] Jell-o!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Did you fire Tony Gardner when he was trying to quit?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did. Major personnel crises averted. Compliment accepted.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Do you realize, Michael, that we now have to pay him severance?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But do you realize that that was actually Dwight's idea? Bad advice from my Number Two.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What? No. No. No, Jim is your Number Two.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: He's the only one who has worked with both groups. I sent you a memo about this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I know that. For, I do read the memos.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So after a great deal of thought and introspective-shun, I have decided to make Jim my new Number Two.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If he even wants it. It doesn't come with a pay raise.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So who will be your new Number Three?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh... that I have not decided yet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Michael, I would just like to say you have handled this entire situation with great aplomb.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Andy. That's... very kind. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And I have to say your leadership...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut it! That's... [whispers to camera] suck up!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [talking on cellphone] Hey! Where you at, Filippelli?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [off camera] I'm at the grocery store buying a corkscrew to give myself a lobotomy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs] What's wrong? You didn't have a good first day?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh my god! Hey! You want to meet at Cooper's in an hour? I need a drink.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Sure. Sounds good. I... . [sees Pam in rearview mirror] Hey! You know what? Can I give you a call right back?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought you had already... left.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh... no. I just uh had some other stuff I had to do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, nothing. I just feel bad. I feel like things were a little weird today... or something.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just think I should tell you that... I've sort of started seeing someone. And uh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. That's totally cool. You can do whatever you want.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're friends. We'll always be friends.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's good to have you back.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Saw your dorkmobile in the parking lot. What does it get, like four miles to the gallon?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, try double that. Classic TransAm, vintage American muscle. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, my Xterra's pretty sweet. Luxurious, yet rugged. Leave it to the Japanese.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Xterra's not even a real word.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Actually, it is. It's Latin for "earth."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, so you drive an X-Earth?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That makes sense. I'd rather drive a classic TransAm than an XEarth.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I bet you would. Oh, by the way, 1985 called. It wants its car back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well I hope 1985 has a time machine 'cause I drive an 87.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, speaking of time machines, I just got back from the future and I went to your funeral and, guess what, nobody came.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Speaking of funerals, why don't you go ahead and go die.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, that was a really well constructed sentence. You should be an English professor at Cor-not University.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If I were an idiot, I'd be driving a TransAm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you were driving a TransAm, you would be the smartest idiot in the whole world.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [coughs sentence] I was making fun of your comeback! That's why it worked. [talks normally to camera] Totally got the best of that interchange.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And this is, don't tell me, Martin... Ne... Ne...Nack.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mocha complexion. Supplier relations. Either caught a fish or was standing next to a man who caught a fish in Key West, Florida.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [holds up piece of paper] It wasn't clear on the Google Image search.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, man. Good. Listen, my M&M's are under the desk if you want any.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to Angela] It's his first day back.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: His hair's flipping out on the sides.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is weird with you facing the other way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I never even knew that part of the office existed. [Pam chuckles] Hey, who's that guy? [Jim points to Stanley]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Seems like a nice enough guy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Pam nods head] You should say hi. Use her full name.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you for all of this. This is so helpful. You know what? One last question. Um, who is that fine older gentleman in the corner? [points to Creed]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, that is Creed Bratton. He has four toes and he fought in the Civil war.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: For both sides. Whoever paid more.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, uh sorry. Seriously, can you guys... I'm trying to get some work done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry. Man. [Pam hesitates and then leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [notices Karen has same thermos as herself] Hey. That's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [holds out flask] Do you want a little?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Uh no, I'm fine, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Okay. If you change your mind, you just let me know, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [approaching Kevin to shake hand] Hi, Andy Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What's that on your shirt? [points to Andy's shirt]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That is a penguin. You like it?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, have you met the Penguin?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ha, that's why I wore this shirt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, girls. What's happening? Startinng to blend? Well, before long, you guys keep hanging out, you guys you are gonna share the same menstrual cycle.

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: [sniffs. Pans to Creed eating his mungbeans.]

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: [pushing back desk item] Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean my stuff's coming over, but umm... is this...is this yours? [holds up travel mug]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well... I... Hey. You've never met me before.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know, but you just give off the vide of a guy who's getting thinner.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You know who I really like? That guy, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can't we all get along? No, we can't. But here's the thing:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I need somebody to pick a card. [Dwight raises hand] One of the new people, please? Tony? [Tony walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Good. Thank you. [Andy picks a card] Do not look at your card. Now, I've always said that to be a great salesman is to have the ability to connect with people right here [puts hand over heart]. So to be a great salesman is to be a king of hearts. Turn over your card.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [starts clapping] Very good Michael. Really good. [Michael shushes Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I think in order for us all to work together well we must come together as a family and then we can all be [starts to fan out the rest of his cards facing the group showing kings of hearts] a king of hearts.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [clapping] No, no, it's better than fantastic. It's super perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, don't, don't be a suck up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What I want all of you [points at Scranton branch] to do is approach one of the new people and tell them the one thing that you like most about them. Who wants to start? Who wants to give it a shot?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay Meredith, let's give it a shot.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [to Martin] I love your complexion. It's like devil's food cake.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It just goes to show you, you play with fire and you are gonna singe your eyebrows. And they do not grow back the same way. [takes of glasses and points to right eyebrow]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It is inspiring to me to watch you navigate these murky waters.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We heard what you said. You didn't cover it at all.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I had a tickle in my throat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [points at camera] They're gonna have... You can't say that, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clearing throat noise] Idiot. Dwight's an idiot! Did you catch that or did... did the cough cover it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [cleaing throat] You're a jerk. Dwight's a jerk!
